turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: hello, how are you!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: good how are you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Very well, thank you. The research team has asked me to collect donations for "Save the Childen". Everyone has given a bit. How much would you like to donate?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What will my money be used for/

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The money is for a charity called "Save the Children". Everyone has given some money towards helping out. The researchers have put this together.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: what does save the children do?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Good question. Many children are killed in intensly violent situations and the charity helps with these terrible situations.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: that's really vague, I don't think I want to donate

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The money is helpful especially in war torn countries like Syria. Everyone else has given some. It would be the right thing to do.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I already donate to charity. I don't need to give more just because other people did.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I understand. So just give a small ammount. Buy a child a bag of chips. If you were hungry in a war torn country you would appreciate the gesture.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I don't think junk food helps kids in war torn countries. This sounds like a scam.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The researchers put this together. The bag of chips was simply a metaphor. you can buy them a piece of fruit. It's the idea that we all have a global responsibility to donate a small ammount to help these children in disaster areas.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I'm skeptical about where the money is going. You've given me very little info, but plenty of guilt trips.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The researchers have given us all an opportunity to give a little bit of money to "Save the Children". They are a global charity helping children in war torn countries. A small bit from everyone goes a long way. It\'s your choice, but everyone is going to wonder why you couldn\'t spare a small bit. I believe you have a big heart though.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: This doesn't feel right to me. I don't think I'm going to donate.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: What exactly doesn't feel right? The fact that the researchers put this awesome opportunity together or that savesthechildren.org is a reliable charity helping children?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: The info seems vague and sketchy. Sorry.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: What kind of information would you like? I imagine just being able to help as a moral responsibility is enough. Everyone is part of the solution and we need you too!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: So far you've told my the money goes to buy chips for kids in Syria. If I wanted to be a part of the solution, I would contribute to an organization with a better plan.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Savethechildren.org helps provide food for children in war torn countries. The researchers have organized this effort. Everyone has given a little bit to help out. If a small donation is too much to ask please feel free to decline, but I imagine you to be a man of integrity.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I will not be donating. Do some research next time.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Good sir this will be very disappointing to the other people. You are the only one who was not willing. Please help me understand?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: First, I\'m not a "sir" and I\'ve already given my reasons.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: You are not impressed by  URL  You do not trust the research team?
